description: From the feminine past participle of Old French charpir (“to pluck”), carpir (“to pluck”), from Latin carpō (“I seize”). Compare carpet.

entries.meaning: (medicine, now historical) Straight threads obtained by unraveling old linen cloth, used for surgical dressings.
examples: M. d'Arblay filled a Closet with Charpie, compresses, and bandages – All that to me was owned, as wanting, was an arm Chair and some Towels.
